search_results.title: RAGAS v2.0 - Latest RAG Evaluation Framework 2025
search_results.content: RAGAS v2.0 released April 28, 2025. Reference-free evaluation with faithfulness, context precision, context recall, answer relevancy metrics. LLM-based evaluation framework.

search_results.title: Arize Phoenix - Open-Source RAG Evaluation and Observability 2025
search_results.content: Phoenix designed for experimentation, data visualization, evaluation, troubleshooting. RAG triad metrics: context relevance, groundedness, answer relevance. UI focused on debugging.

search_results.title: LangSmith RAG Evaluation - 2025 Latest Features
search_results.content: LangSmith 2025 updates: Align Evals, Trace Mode in Studio, cross-framework support. Correctness, groundedness, relevance evaluators. Human feedback integration.

search_results.title: RAG Evaluation Best Practices - Industry Standards 2025
search_results.content: Minimum 20 questions for personal projects, 100 for enterprise. Component-level evaluation: retrieval metrics, generation metrics. Production monitoring essential.

search_results.title: DeepEval - 14+ LLM Evaluation Metrics for RAG 2025
search_results.content: DeepEval offers 14+ evaluation metrics for RAG and fine-tuning. Updated with latest research. Self-explaining metrics for debugging. Enterprise-ready evaluation.

search_results.title: Enterprise RAG Evaluation Framework Comparison 2025
search_results.content: Head-to-head comparison of RAG evaluation frameworks. TruLens for domain-specific optimization, Phoenix for debugging, Arize for monitoring. Enterprise considerations.

ragas.name: RAGAS (Retrieval Augmented Generation Assessment)
key_features: Faithfulness, Context Precision, Context Recall, Answer Relevancy
Cost-effective evaluation without ground truth labels

arize_phoenix.name: Arize Phoenix
key_features: RAG triad metrics (context relevance, groundedness, answer relevance)
UI focused on troubleshooting RAG scenarios

langsmith.name: LangSmith
key_features: Trace Mode in Studio for debugging

trulens.name: TruLens
key_features: RAG triad metrics with detailed analysis
Feedback functions for LLM call analysis

deepeval.name: DeepEval
key_features: 14+ evaluation metrics for RAG and fine-tuning
Updated with latest LLM evaluation research
Both RAG and agentic workflow support

best_practices.title: RAG Evaluation Dataset Sizing (2025 Industry Standard)
best_practices.description: Minimum dataset size recommendations based on project scope and requirements
best_practices.implementation: Personal projects: minimum 20 questions. Enterprise projects: minimum 100 questions. Production systems: 500+ questions with continuous evaluation

best_practices.title: Component-Level RAG Evaluation Strategy
best_practices.description: Separate evaluation of retrieval and generation components for targeted optimization
best_practices.implementation: Evaluate retrieval metrics (precision, recall, MRR) independently from generation metrics (faithfulness, relevance). Use RAG triad: context relevance, groundedness, answer relevance

best_practices.title: Continuous RAG Evaluation in Production
best_practices.description: Real-time monitoring and evaluation of RAG systems in production environments
best_practices.implementation: Implement automated evaluation pipelines, track business-critical metrics (cost, latency, quality), set up alerts for performance degradation, use human feedback loops

best_practices.title: RAG Evaluation Framework Selection Strategy
best_practices.description: Choose appropriate evaluation framework based on use case and requirements
best_practices.implementation: RAGAS for reference-free evaluation, Phoenix for debugging and troubleshooting, TruLens for domain-specific optimization, LangSmith for cross-framework support

code_examples.title: RAGAS v2.0 Comprehensive RAG Evaluation
code_examples.description: Complete RAG evaluation implementation using RAGAS 2025 version with all core metrics
code_examples.code:
from ragas import evaluate
from ragas.metrics import (
    faithfulness,
    answer_relevancy,
    context_precision,
    context_recall,
    answer_correctness,
    answer_similarity
)
from datasets import Dataset
import pandas as pd
from typing import List, Dict, Any
import asyncio

class RAGEvaluationSuite:
    """Comprehensive RAG evaluation using RAGAS v2.0 (2025)"""
    
    def __init__(self, llm_model: str = "gpt-4", embedding_model: str = "text-embedding-3-large"):
        self.llm_model = llm_model
        self.embedding_model = embedding_model
        self.metrics = [
            faithfulness,
            answer_relevancy, 
            context_precision,
            context_recall,
            answer_correctness,
            answer_similarity
        ]
        
    def prepare_evaluation_dataset(self, 
                                 questions: List[str],
                                 answers: List[str],
                                 contexts: List[List[str]],
                                 ground_truths: List[str] = None) -> Dataset:
        """Prepare dataset for RAGAS evaluation"""
        
        eval_data = {
            'question': questions,
            'answer': answers,
            'contexts': contexts
        }
        
        # Add ground truth if available (required for context_recall)
        if ground_truths:
            eval_data['ground_truth'] = ground_truths
            
        return Dataset.from_dict(eval_data)
    
    async def evaluate_rag_system(self, evaluation_dataset: Dataset) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Evaluate RAG system with comprehensive metrics"""
        
        # Configure metrics for specific LLM and embedding models
        configured_metrics = []
        for metric in self.metrics:
            # Skip context_recall if no ground truth available
            if metric == context_recall and 'ground_truth' not in evaluation_dataset.column_names:
                continue
            configured_metrics.append(metric)
        
        # Run evaluation
        result = evaluate(
            dataset=evaluation_dataset,
            metrics=configured_metrics,
            llm=self.llm_model,
            embeddings=self.embedding_model
        )
        
        return self._process_results(result)
    
    def _process_results(self, result) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Process and format evaluation results"""
        
        processed_results = {
            'overall_scores': {},
            'individual_scores': result.to_pandas(),
            'summary_statistics': {},
            'recommendations': []
        }
        
        # Calculate overall scores
        df = result.to_pandas()
        for metric in df.columns:
            if metric not in ['question', 'answer', 'contexts', 'ground_truth']:
                processed_results['overall_scores'][metric] = {
                    'mean': df[metric].mean(),
                    'median': df[metric].median(),
                    'std': df[metric].std(),
                    'min': df[metric].min(),
                    'max': df[metric].max()
                }
        
        # Generate recommendations
        processed_results['recommendations'] = self._generate_recommendations(
            processed_results['overall_scores']
        )
        
        return processed_results
    
    def _generate_recommendations(self, scores: Dict[str, Dict]) -> List[str]:
        """Generate improvement recommendations based on scores"""
        recommendations = []
        
        # Check faithfulness
        if 'faithfulness' in scores and scores['faithfulness']['mean'] < 0.8:
            recommendations.append(
                "Low faithfulness score detected. Consider improving retrieval quality "
                "or adding fact-checking mechanisms."
            )
        
        # Check answer relevancy
        if 'answer_relevancy' in scores and scores['answer_relevancy']['mean'] < 0.7:
            recommendations.append(
                "Low answer relevancy. Review generation prompts and consider "
                "fine-tuning the language model."
            )
        
        # Check context precision
        if 'context_precision' in scores and scores['context_precision']['mean'] < 0.6:
            recommendations.append(
                "Low context precision. Improve retrieval ranking algorithms "
                "or adjust chunk size and overlap parameters."
            )
        
        # Check context recall
        if 'context_recall' in scores and scores['context_recall']['mean'] < 0.7:
            recommendations.append(
                "Low context recall. Expand retrieval scope or improve "
                "document indexing and search strategies."
            )
        
        return recommendations
    
    def generate_evaluation_report(self, results: Dict[str, Any], 
                                 output_path: str = "rag_evaluation_report.md") -> str:
        """Generate comprehensive evaluation report"""
        
        report_content = f"""# RAG System Evaluation Report\n\nGenerated using RAGAS v2.0 (2025)\n\n## Overall Performance\n\n"""
        
        # Add overall scores
        for metric, stats in results['overall_scores'].items():
            report_content += f"### {metric.replace('_', ' ').title()}\n"
            report_content += f"- Mean Score: {stats['mean']:.3f}\n"
            report_content += f"- Median Score: {stats['median']:.3f}\n"
            report_content += f"- Standard Deviation: {stats['std']:.3f}\n"
            report_content += f"- Range: {stats['min']:.3f} - {stats['max']:.3f}\n\n"
        
        # Add recommendations
        if results['recommendations']:
            report_content += "## Recommendations\n\n"
            for i, rec in enumerate(results['recommendations'], 1):
                report_content += f"{i}. {rec}\n\n"
        
        # Add detailed scores table
        report_content += "## Detailed Scores\n\n"
        df = results['individual_scores']
        report_content += df.to_markdown(index=False, floatfmt=".3f")
        
        # Save report
        with open(output_path, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
            f.write(report_content)
            
        return output_path

# Usage Example
async def run_rag_evaluation():
    # Sample data (replace with your RAG system outputs)
    questions = [
        "What is the capital of France?",
        "How does photosynthesis work?",
        "What are the benefits of renewable energy?"
    ]
    
    answers = [
        "Paris is the capital of France and its largest city.",
        "Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert sunlight into energy using chlorophyll.",
        "Renewable energy reduces carbon emissions and provides sustainable power sources."
    ]
    
    contexts = [
        ["Paris is the capital and most populous city of France.", "France is a country in Western Europe."],
        ["Plants use sunlight to create glucose through photosynthesis.", "Chlorophyll is the green pigment in plants."],
        ["Solar and wind energy are renewable sources.", "Renewable energy helps combat climate change."]
    ]
    
    ground_truths = [
        "Paris",
        "Photosynthesis converts sunlight to chemical energy in plants",
        "Renewable energy is sustainable and environmentally friendly"
    ]
    
    # Initialize evaluation suite
    evaluator = RAGEvaluationSuite()
    
    # Prepare dataset
    eval_dataset = evaluator.prepare_evaluation_dataset(
        questions=questions,
        answers=answers,
        contexts=contexts,
        ground_truths=ground_truths
    )
    
    # Run evaluation
    results = await evaluator.evaluate_rag_system(eval_dataset)
    
    # Generate report
    report_path = evaluator.generate_evaluation_report(results)
    
    print(f"Evaluation completed. Report saved to: {report_path}")
    print(f"Overall Faithfulness: {results['overall_scores']['faithfulness']['mean']:.3f}")
    print(f"Overall Answer Relevancy: {results['overall_scores']['answer_relevancy']['mean']:.3f}")
    
    return results

# Run the evaluation
if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    results = asyncio.run(run_rag_evaluation())

code_examples.title: Multi-Framework RAG Evaluation Pipeline
code_examples.description: Production-ready evaluation pipeline supporting RAGAS, Phoenix, and LangSmith

code_examples.title: Production RAG Evaluation Monitoring System
code_examples.description: Enterprise-ready continuous RAG evaluation and monitoring system for production environments
code_examples.code:
import asyncio
import logging
import json
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional, Callable
from dataclasses import dataclass, asdict
from collections import defaultdict, deque
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from pathlib import Path
import schedule
import time
import threading

# Configure logging
logging.basicConfig(
    level=logging.INFO,
    format='%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',
    handlers=[
        logging.FileHandler('rag_monitoring.log'),
        logging.StreamHandler()
    ]
)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

@dataclass
class RAGMetrics:
    timestamp: datetime
    session_id: str
    question: str
    answer: str
    contexts: List[str]
    response_time: float
    retrieval_score: float
    generation_score: float
    user_feedback: Optional[int] = None
    cost_usd: Optional[float] = None
    model_version: str = "default"
    
@dataclass
class AlertConfig:
    metric_name: str
    threshold: float
    comparison: str  # 'below', 'above'
    window_minutes: int
    min_samples: int
    alert_cooldown_minutes: int = 60

class ProductionRAGMonitor:
    """Production-ready RAG evaluation and monitoring system (2025)"""
    
    def __init__(self, config_path: str = "rag_monitor_config.json"):
        self.config = self._load_config(config_path)
        self.metrics_buffer = deque(maxlen=self.config.get('buffer_size', 10000))
        self.alert_history = defaultdict(lambda: datetime.min)
        self.evaluation_callbacks = []
        self.is_monitoring = False
        self.monitor_thread = None
        self.metrics_db_path = Path(self.config.get('metrics_db_path', 'rag_metrics.jsonl'))
        
        # Performance tracking
        self.performance_windows = {
            'hourly': deque(maxlen=24),    # 24 hours
            'daily': deque(maxlen=30),     # 30 days
            'weekly': deque(maxlen=52)     # 52 weeks
        }
        
        # Initialize alert configurations
        self.alert_configs = self._load_alert_configs()
        
        logger.info("Production RAG Monitor initialized")
    
    def _load_config(self, config_path: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Load monitoring configuration"""
        default_config = {
            'buffer_size': 10000,
            'metrics_db_path': 'rag_metrics.jsonl',
            'evaluation_interval_minutes': 15,
            'alert_webhook_url': None,
            'dashboard_port': 8080,
            'quality_thresholds': {
                'retrieval_score_min': 0.7,
                'generation_score_min': 0.8,
                'response_time_max': 5.0,
                'user_feedback_min': 3.0
            },
            'cost_limits': {
                'hourly_budget_usd': 100.0,
                'daily_budget_usd': 2000.0
            }
        }
        
        try:
            with open(config_path, 'r') as f:
                user_config = json.load(f)
                default_config.update(user_config)
        except FileNotFoundError:
            logger.warning(f"Config file {config_path} not found, using defaults")
        
        return default_config
    
    def _load_alert_configs(self) -> List[AlertConfig]:
        """Load alert configurations"""
        return [
            AlertConfig(
                metric_name='retrieval_score',
                threshold=self.config['quality_thresholds']['retrieval_score_min'],
                comparison='below',
                window_minutes=30,
                min_samples=10
            ),
            AlertConfig(
                metric_name='generation_score', 
                threshold=self.config['quality_thresholds']['generation_score_min'],
                comparison='below',
                window_minutes=30,
                min_samples=10
            ),
            AlertConfig(
                metric_name='response_time',
                threshold=self.config['quality_thresholds']['response_time_max'],
                comparison='above',
                window_minutes=15,
                min_samples=5
            ),
            AlertConfig(
                metric_name='cost_usd',
                threshold=self.config['cost_limits']['hourly_budget_usd'],
                comparison='above',
                window_minutes=60,
                min_samples=1
            )
        ]
    
    def log_interaction(self, 
                       session_id: str,
                       question: str,
                       answer: str,
                       contexts: List[str],
                       response_time: float,
                       retrieval_score: float = None,
                       generation_score: float = None,
                       cost_usd: float = None,
                       model_version: str = "default") -> None:
        """Log a RAG interaction for monitoring"""
        
        metrics = RAGMetrics(
            timestamp=datetime.now(),
            session_id=session_id,
            question=question,
            answer=answer,
            contexts=contexts,
            response_time=response_time,
            retrieval_score=retrieval_score or self._estimate_retrieval_score(contexts, question),
            generation_score=generation_score or self._estimate_generation_score(answer, question),
            cost_usd=cost_usd,
            model_version=model_version
        )
        
        # Add to buffer
        self.metrics_buffer.append(metrics)
        
        # Persist to storage
        self._persist_metrics(metrics)
        
        # Trigger real-time evaluation callbacks
        self._trigger_evaluation_callbacks(metrics)
        
        # Check for alerts
        self._check_alerts()
        
        logger.debug(f"Logged interaction for session {session_id}")
    
    def _estimate_retrieval_score(self, contexts: List[str], question: str) -> float:
        """Estimate retrieval score based on context relevance"""
        # Simple heuristic - replace with actual evaluation
        question_words = set(question.lower().split())
        context_text = ' '.join(contexts).lower()
        
        overlap = sum(1 for word in question_words if word in context_text)
        return min(overlap / len(question_words), 1.0) if question_words else 0.0
    
    def _estimate_generation_score(self, answer: str, question: str) -> float:
        """Estimate generation score based on answer quality"""
        # Simple heuristic - replace with actual evaluation
        if not answer.strip():
            return 0.0
        
        # Check for reasonable length and structure
        word_count = len(answer.split())
        has_punctuation = any(p in answer for p in '.!?')
        
        base_score = 0.5
        if 10 <= word_count <= 200:
            base_score += 0.2
        if has_punctuation:
            base_score += 0.1
        if len(answer) > len(question) * 2:
            base_score += 0.2
            
        return min(base_score, 1.0)
    
    def _persist_metrics(self, metrics: RAGMetrics) -> None:
        """Persist metrics to storage"""
        try:
            with open(self.metrics_db_path, 'a', encoding='utf-8') as f:
                json.dump(asdict(metrics), f, default=str)
                f.write('\n')
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Failed to persist metrics: {e}")
    
    def _trigger_evaluation_callbacks(self, metrics: RAGMetrics) -> None:
        """Trigger registered evaluation callbacks"""
        for callback in self.evaluation_callbacks:
            try:
                callback(metrics)
            except Exception as e:
                logger.error(f"Evaluation callback error: {e}")
    
    def add_evaluation_callback(self, callback: Callable[[RAGMetrics], None]) -> None:
        """Add evaluation callback function"""
        self.evaluation_callbacks.append(callback)
        logger.info("Added evaluation callback")
    
    def _check_alerts(self) -> None:
        """Check for alert conditions"""
        current_time = datetime.now()
        
        for alert_config in self.alert_configs:
            # Check cooldown
            last_alert = self.alert_history[alert_config.metric_name]
            cooldown_end = last_alert + timedelta(minutes=alert_config.alert_cooldown_minutes)
            
            if current_time < cooldown_end:
                continue
            
            # Get recent metrics within window
            window_start = current_time - timedelta(minutes=alert_config.window_minutes)
            recent_metrics = [
                m for m in self.metrics_buffer 
                if m.timestamp >= window_start
            ]
            
            if len(recent_metrics) < alert_config.min_samples:
                continue
            
            # Extract metric values
            metric_values = []
            for m in recent_metrics:
                if alert_config.metric_name == 'retrieval_score':
                    metric_values.append(m.retrieval_score)
                elif alert_config.metric_name == 'generation_score':
                    metric_values.append(m.generation_score)
                elif alert_config.metric_name == 'response_time':
                    metric_values.append(m.response_time)
                elif alert_config.metric_name == 'cost_usd' and m.cost_usd:
                    metric_values.append(m.cost_usd)
            
            if not metric_values:
                continue
            
            # Check threshold
            avg_value = np.mean(metric_values)
            alert_triggered = False
            
            if alert_config.comparison == 'below' and avg_value < alert_config.threshold:
                alert_triggered = True
            elif alert_config.comparison == 'above' and avg_value > alert_config.threshold:
                alert_triggered = True
            
            if alert_triggered:
                self._send_alert(alert_config, avg_value, len(metric_values))
                self.alert_history[alert_config.metric_name] = current_time
    
    def _send_alert(self, alert_config: AlertConfig, current_value: float, sample_count: int) -> None:
        """Send alert notification"""
        alert_message = {
            'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(),
            'metric': alert_config.metric_name,
            'threshold': alert_config.threshold,
            'current_value': current_value,
            'comparison': alert_config.comparison,
            'sample_count': sample_count,
            'window_minutes': alert_config.window_minutes,
            'severity': 'high' if abs(current_value - alert_config.threshold) > alert_config.threshold * 0.2 else 'medium'
        }
        
        logger.warning(f"RAG Alert: {alert_config.metric_name} is {current_value:.3f} "
                      f"({alert_config.comparison} threshold {alert_config.threshold})")
        
        # Send webhook if configured
        webhook_url = self.config.get('alert_webhook_url')
        if webhook_url:
            self._send_webhook_alert(webhook_url, alert_message)
    
    def _send_webhook_alert(self, webhook_url: str, alert_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
        """Send alert via webhook"""
        try:
            import requests
            response = requests.post(webhook_url, json=alert_data, timeout=10)
            response.raise_for_status()
            logger.info("Alert webhook sent successfully")
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Failed to send webhook alert: {e}")
    
    def get_performance_summary(self, window: str = 'hourly') -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get performance summary for specified window"""
        if window not in ['hourly', 'daily', 'weekly']:
            raise ValueError("Window must be 'hourly', 'daily', or 'weekly'")
        
        # Calculate time range
        now = datetime.now()
        if window == 'hourly':
            start_time = now - timedelta(hours=1)
        elif window == 'daily':
            start_time = now - timedelta(days=1)
        else:  # weekly
            start_time = now - timedelta(weeks=1)
        
        # Filter metrics
        recent_metrics = [
            m for m in self.metrics_buffer
            if m.timestamp >= start_time
        ]
        
        if not recent_metrics:
            return {'error': f'No metrics available for {window} window'}
        
        # Calculate summary statistics
        retrieval_scores = [m.retrieval_score for m in recent_metrics if m.retrieval_score]
        generation_scores = [m.generation_score for m in recent_metrics if m.generation_score]
        response_times = [m.response_time for m in recent_metrics]
        costs = [m.cost_usd for m in recent_metrics if m.cost_usd]
        
        summary = {
            'window': window,
            'period': f"{start_time.isoformat()} to {now.isoformat()}",
            'total_interactions': len(recent_metrics),
            'unique_sessions': len(set(m.session_id for m in recent_metrics)),
            'performance': {
                'avg_retrieval_score': np.mean(retrieval_scores) if retrieval_scores else None,
                'avg_generation_score': np.mean(generation_scores) if generation_scores else None,
                'avg_response_time': np.mean(response_times),
                'total_cost_usd': sum(costs) if costs else None
            },
            'quality_distribution': {
                'retrieval_above_threshold': len([s for s in retrieval_scores if s >= self.config['quality_thresholds']['retrieval_score_min']]) / len(retrieval_scores) if retrieval_scores else None,
                'generation_above_threshold': len([s for s in generation_scores if s >= self.config['quality_thresholds']['generation_score_min']]) / len(generation_scores) if generation_scores else None,
                'response_time_below_threshold': len([t for t in response_times if t <= self.config['quality_thresholds']['response_time_max']]) / len(response_times)
            }
        }
        
        return summary
    
    def start_monitoring(self) -> None:
        """Start continuous monitoring"""
        if self.is_monitoring:
            logger.warning("Monitoring already started")
            return
        
        self.is_monitoring = True
        
        def monitor_loop():
            schedule.every(self.config['evaluation_interval_minutes']).minutes.do(self._periodic_evaluation)
            schedule.every(1).hour.do(self._update_performance_windows)
            
            while self.is_monitoring:
                schedule.run_pending()
                time.sleep(60)  # Check every minute
        
        self.monitor_thread = threading.Thread(target=monitor_loop, daemon=True)
        self.monitor_thread.start()
        
        logger.info("Production RAG monitoring started")
    
    def stop_monitoring(self) -> None:
        """Stop continuous monitoring"""
        self.is_monitoring = False
        if self.monitor_thread:
            self.monitor_thread.join(timeout=5)
        
        logger.info("Production RAG monitoring stopped")
    
    def _periodic_evaluation(self) -> None:
        """Periodic evaluation and reporting"""
        try:
            summary = self.get_performance_summary('hourly')
            logger.info(f"Hourly performance summary: {json.dumps(summary, indent=2, default=str)}")
            
            # Additional periodic tasks
            self._cleanup_old_metrics()
            self._update_performance_windows()
            
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Periodic evaluation error: {e}")
    
    def _cleanup_old_metrics(self) -> None:
        """Clean up old metrics from buffer"""
        cutoff_time = datetime.now() - timedelta(hours=24)
        original_size = len(self.metrics_buffer)
        
        # Convert to list, filter, and convert back
        filtered_metrics = [m for m in self.metrics_buffer if m.timestamp >= cutoff_time]
        self.metrics_buffer.clear()
        self.metrics_buffer.extend(filtered_metrics)
        
        cleaned_count = original_size - len(self.metrics_buffer)
        if cleaned_count > 0:
            logger.info(f"Cleaned up {cleaned_count} old metrics from buffer")
    
    def _update_performance_windows(self) -> None:
        """Update performance tracking windows"""
        try:
            hourly_summary = self.get_performance_summary('hourly')
            self.performance_windows['hourly'].append(hourly_summary)
            
            if len(self.performance_windows['hourly']) >= 24:
                daily_summary = self.get_performance_summary('daily')
                self.performance_windows['daily'].append(daily_summary)
            
            if len(self.performance_windows['daily']) >= 7:
                weekly_summary = self.get_performance_summary('weekly')
                self.performance_windows['weekly'].append(weekly_summary)
                
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error(f"Failed to update performance windows: {e}")

# Usage Example
def setup_production_monitoring():
    # Initialize monitor
    monitor = ProductionRAGMonitor()
    
    # Add custom evaluation callback
    def custom_evaluation_callback(metrics: RAGMetrics):
        if metrics.retrieval_score < 0.5:
            logger.warning(f"Low retrieval score detected: {metrics.retrieval_score:.3f} for session {metrics.session_id}")
    
    monitor.add_evaluation_callback(custom_evaluation_callback)
    
    # Start monitoring
    monitor.start_monitoring()
    
    return monitor

# Simulate RAG interactions
async def simulate_rag_interactions(monitor: ProductionRAGMonitor):
    import uuid
    import random
    
    for i in range(50):
        session_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
        
        # Simulate RAG interaction
        monitor.log_interaction(
            session_id=session_id,
            question=f"Sample question {i}",
            answer=f"Sample answer {i} with detailed information",
            contexts=[f"Context {i}.1", f"Context {i}.2"],
            response_time=random.uniform(0.5, 3.0),
            retrieval_score=random.uniform(0.6, 0.95),
            generation_score=random.uniform(0.7, 0.95),
            cost_usd=random.uniform(0.01, 0.05)
        )
        
        await asyncio.sleep(0.1)  # Small delay
    
    # Get performance summary
    summary = monitor.get_performance_summary('hourly')
    print(json.dumps(summary, indent=2, default=str))

if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Setup and run monitoring
    monitor = setup_production_monitoring()
    
    # Simulate interactions
    asyncio.run(simulate_rag_interactions(monitor))
    
    # Let it run for a bit
    time.sleep(60)
    
    # Stop monitoring
    monitor.stop_monitoring()

performance_benchmarks.description: Performance metrics from RAGAS framework 2025 release
performance_benchmarks.baseline: RAGAS v1.0: 5-10 seconds per sample evaluation
performance_benchmarks.optimized: RAGAS v2.0: 2-5 seconds per sample with LLM-based evaluation

performance_benchmarks.description: Execution time comparison across RAG evaluation frameworks
Performance impact of continuous RAG monitoring in production
performance_benchmarks.lightweight_monitoring: Basic metrics logging: <5ms overhead per request
performance_benchmarks.comprehensive_monitoring: Full evaluation pipeline: 10-50ms overhead per request

performance_benchmarks.description: Recommended dataset sizes for enterprise RAG evaluation
performance_benchmarks.continuous_evaluation: 20-100 new samples weekly for ongoing monitoring

troubleshooting.issue: RAGAS evaluation returns inconsistent scores across runs
root_causes: Different OpenAI model versions between runs
solutions: Use deterministic evaluation with fixed seeds
troubleshooting.verification: Run same evaluation 3 times, scores should be identical within 0.01 variance

troubleshooting.issue: LLM-as-Judge evaluation bias towards longer answers
symptoms: Concise but accurate answers get low scores
Answer relevancy metric favors length over quality
root_causes: Default prompts emphasize completeness over accuracy
LLM judge trained on verbose examples
solutions: Use balanced evaluation datasets with varied answer lengths
Implement custom evaluation prompts focusing on accuracy
Use multiple evaluation models for cross-validation
troubleshooting.verification: Create test cases with identical content but different lengths, scores should be similar

troubleshooting.issue: Context precision metric failing with hierarchical documents
symptoms: Context precision always 0 for document chunks
root_causes: Chunk boundaries don't align with semantic boundaries
solutions: Add document structure metadata to chunks
Use sliding window overlap for better context
Custom evaluation logic for nested documents
troubleshooting.verification: Test with documents of different hierarchical depths, precision should reflect actual relevance

common_pitfalls.mistake: Using only automated metrics without human evaluation
common_pitfalls.consequences: Missing subtle quality issues, overconfidence in system performance
common_pitfalls.prevention: Combine automated metrics with regular human evaluation sessions
common_pitfalls.recovery: Implement human-in-the-loop validation for edge cases

common_pitfalls.mistake: Evaluating on training data or similar distributions
common_pitfalls.prevention: Use completely separate evaluation datasets from different domains
common_pitfalls.recovery: Create new evaluation datasets from production queries

common_pitfalls.mistake: Not monitoring evaluation metric degradation over time
common_pitfalls.consequences: Silent system degradation, user experience deterioration
common_pitfalls.prevention: Set up continuous monitoring with alerting on metric thresholds
common_pitfalls.recovery: Implement automated rollback based on evaluation scores

latest_trends_2025.migration_notes: Breaking changes in metric API, requires OpenAI GPT-4V for image evaluation

latest_trends_2025.trend: LangSmith Align Evals for production deployment
key_features: Gradual rollout based on evaluation scores

latest_trends_2025.community_feedback: Significant improvement in debugging complex RAG failures

production_patterns.scenario: Continuous RAG evaluation in production at scale
production_patterns.architecture: Sampling-based evaluation (1% traffic) + batch processing + real-time alerting
lessons_learned: Sample representative traffic, not random
Cache expensive LLM evaluations
Use lightweight metrics for real-time, comprehensive for batch
production_patterns.monitoring_setup: Custom Grafana dashboards with RAGAS metrics, PagerDuty alerts on score drops

security_guidelines.title: RAG Evaluation Data Privacy Protection
security_guidelines.description: Protect sensitive data used in RAG evaluation datasets and production monitoring
security_guidelines.mitigation: Implement data anonymization, PII detection in evaluation datasets, secure storage for evaluation results, GDPR-compliant data handling

security_guidelines.title: LLM-Based Evaluation Security
security_guidelines.description: Security considerations for using LLMs to evaluate RAG systems
security_guidelines.mitigation: Validate LLM evaluation outputs, implement prompt injection protection for evaluation queries, use multiple evaluation models for cross-validation

security_guidelines.title: Production Monitoring Access Control
security_guidelines.description: Secure access to RAG monitoring dashboards and evaluation results
security_guidelines.mitigation: Implement role-based access control, encrypt evaluation data in transit and at rest, audit logging for evaluation system access

security_guidelines.title: Evaluation Framework Supply Chain Security
security_guidelines.description: Ensure integrity of evaluation frameworks and dependencies
security_guidelines.mitigation: Verify package signatures, use pinned versions for evaluation dependencies, regular security updates for evaluation frameworks

performance_impact.evaluation_latency: Sub-second for cached results, 2s for new evaluations

changes_required: Add edge evaluation nodes for reduced latency
Implement evaluation result analytics and insights

lessons_learned: Tenant isolation critical for evaluation consistency
Cache evaluation models per tenant for 3x speedup
Implement circuit breakers for LLM API failures
Real-time evaluation monitoring prevents quality drift

lessons_learned: Streaming evaluation prevents batch processing delays
Threshold tuning critical for noise reduction
Context-aware evaluation more accurate than static rules
Historical evaluation data improves model performance

lessons_learned: Stratified sampling improves experiment validity
Evaluation metric correlation analysis prevents gaming
Automated stopping rules prevent overspending
Cross-metric evaluation provides holistic view

expanded_production_patterns.architecture: Audit-trail enabled evaluation with blockchain verification

Bias detection algorithms required for fairness
Regular evaluation model retraining for drift prevention

expanded_production_patterns.architecture: Language-specific evaluation models with unified reporting

Cultural context affects evaluation criteria significantly
Translation quality impacts final evaluation scores
Native speaker validation essential for accuracy
